item.title: Removing objects handler
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

two things: deletethatobject doesn’t do anything. It’ll call the void correctly, but the void doesn’t do anything. And Deleteobjects is pretty pointless. You should write a command to call it with the coords of the object you want to delete.

Read full topic

item.title: Removing objects handler
item.dc:creator: @SmokeSome SmokeSome
item.description:
@SmokeSome wrote:

Well, i made a “RemovalHandler” and it compiled correctly, but once i try to remove an object, nothing happens. This is what is inside of RemovalHandler;

[code]
public class RemovalHandler {

public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) {

}

public void Deleteobjects() {
deletethatobject(3251, 3419); //Furnace Room Table

}
}[/code

What did i do wrong?[/code]

Read full topic
